intro: Didymocarpus mengtze var. zhenkangensis, commonly known as the Zhenkang stonecress, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and pinnately divided leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous regions, adapting to harsh environmental conditions. Its botanical features include glandular hairs on the stems and leaves, which aid in reducing water loss. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a valuable species for botanical research and conservation efforts.
